description:
There are lots of other advantages of running a full, static HTML website.

The post 3 Best Free and Open Source Awk Static Site Generators appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 3 Best Free and Open Source Awk Static Site Generators

description:
Amarok 3.1.1, a free and open-source music player, has been released with enhanced toolbars, track editor fixes, and more.

The post Amarok 3.1.1 Promises Smoother Performance and UI Fixes appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Amarok 3.1.1 Promises Smoother Performance and UI Fixes

description:
Dubbed “Péter” and coming six months after FFmpeg 7.0, the FFmpeg 7.1 release brings a full native Intel QSV-accelerated VVC decoder, a new MV-HEVC decoder, a new LC-EVC decoder, a new xHE-AAC decoder, an LCEVC filter, Vulkan H.264 and H.265 encoders, and a D3D12VA HEVC encoder.

The post FFmpeg 7.1 “Péter” Released with Full Native VVC Decoder, MV-HEVC Decoder, and More appeared first on Linux Today.
title: FFmpeg 7.1 “Péter” Released with Full Native VVC Decoder, MV-HEVC Decoder, and More

description:
The popular open-source email client, Mozilla Thunderbird, has launched a beta version of its Android app with a range of new features and improvements.

The post Mozilla Thunderbird Lands On Android With New Beta Release appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Mozilla Thunderbird Lands On Android With New Beta Release

description:
Linux Mint unveils a darker, modern theme with rounded objects and redesigned dialogs for the upcoming Cinnamon 6.4 desktop environment.

The post Cinnamon 6.4 Promises Pleasant Surprises for Desktop Users appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Cinnamon 6.4 Promises Pleasant Surprises for Desktop Users

description:
Highlights of qBittorrent 5.0 include Qt 6 modern user interface, support for systemd power management and support for localized man pages on Linux, along with the ability to specify a locale if none is set, support for Mark-of-the-Web, and support for creating .torrent files with a larger piece size.

The post qBittorrent 5.0 BitTorrent Client Adds Support for Systemd Power Management appeared first on Linux Today.
title: qBittorrent 5.0 BitTorrent Client Adds Support for Systemd Power Management

description:
Void Linux finally replaces Python 2 with Python 3 and upgrades its buildbot to enhance package delivery.

The post Void Linux (Finally) Bids Farewell to Python 2 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Void Linux (Finally) Bids Farewell to Python 2

description:
Arch Linux announces a collaboration with gaming giant Valve, focusing on developing a robust build service infrastructure and a secure signing enclave.

The post Arch Linux and Valve Team Up for a Secure, Streamlined Future appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Arch Linux and Valve Team Up for a Secure, Streamlined Future

description:

title: Install and Use Grunt JavaScript Task Runner on Linux & macOS

description:
Learn how to install Docker Desktop on Linux Mint 22. Follow our step-by-step guide to set up and run containers effortlessly on your Mint system.

The post How to Install Docker Desktop on Linux Mint 22 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Docker Desktop on Linux Mint 22

description:
GNOME PowerTracker is a useful tool designed for users of GNOME-based systems, particularly those running Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. This extension allows users to monitor power consumption and battery usage in real time, providing a visual representation of how different applications and settings impact energy demands. The GNOME PowerTracker extension is lightweight and does not require […]

The post How to Display Power Usage in Watts on Ubuntu’s Top Bar appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Display Power Usage in Watts on Ubuntu’s Top Bar

description:
Valve and Arch Linux join forces, speeding up key projects with a build service and secure signing enclave. Here’s more on that!

The post Arch Linux Announces Collaboration with Valve appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Arch Linux Announces Collaboration with Valve

description:
Arch Linux has announced a new partnership with Valve, the company behind the Steam gaming platform and Steam Deck.

The post Arch Linux Announces Collaboration with Valve for Enhanced Build Service and Secure Signing appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Arch Linux Announces Collaboration with Valve for Enhanced Build Service and Secure Signing

description:
Here’s the problem: You spin up a Terraform resource, pull a basic configuration from the registry, and start wondering what other parameters should be enabled to make it more secure and efficient. Sure, you could use tools like TLint or TFSec, but kuzco saves you time by avoiding the need to dig through the Terraform registry and decipher […]

The post An Extremely Practical Use for AI and Terraform appeared first on Linux Today.
title: An Extremely Practical Use for AI and Terraform
